lpctools.configs.title: LPCTools configs - %s
lpctools.configs.generic.title: Generic
lpctools.configs.generic.configOpenGui.c: The key open the in-game config GUI
lpctools.configs.tools.title: Tools
lpctools.configs.tools.FA.name: Filling Assistant Config
lpctools.configs.tools.FA.comment:
Enable to list the configs for Filling Assistant
This tool helps you set blocks to fill holes automatically
lpctools.configs.tools.FA.limitPlaceSpee:
Limit the filling speed of the filling assistant
Prevent being kicked out of some servers due to excessive packet sending

Set the maximum number of blocks
the filling assistant can fill per tick on average
If ghost blocks or ghost items often appears,
you can try to decrease this value
lpctools.configs.tools.FA.testDistance.c:
A higher value allows the Fill Assistant
to search paths within a larger radius
This improves accuracy in detecting
whether block placement will block the original path
but may significantly impact performance with larger values
lpctools.configs.tools.FA.disableOnLeftD:
Disables Filling Assistant in game
when left mouse button down
lpctools.configs.tools.FA.disableOnGUIOp:
Disables Filling Assistant when GUI
(such as config screen, ESC screen or inventory screen)
opened
lpctools.configs.tools.FA.placeableItems: Items that can be placed as blocks by fillingAssistant
lpctools.configs.tools.FA.passableBlocks: Blocks that referred to as passage by fillingAssistant
lpctools.configs.tools.FA.transparentAsP:
Let the filling assistant
treat all transparent blocks
as passable when pathfinding
lpctools.configs.tools.FA.notOpaqueAsPas:
Let the filling assistant
treat all non-opaque blocks
as passable when pathfinding
§8Don't ask me if this is a duplicate of the one above
§8If you ask, it's because Mojang did something weird
§8isTransparent() and !isOpaque() are not necessarily equal
lpctools.configs.tools.FA.requiredBlocks:
Blocks that reserved when filling blocks
No blocks will be placed next to such block by Filling Assistant.
lpctools.configs.tools.FA.offhandFilling: Uses offhand to operate when enabled
lpctools.configs.tools.FA.limitRange.out:
Refer to outer range blocks
as unpassable, passable or origin
lpctools.configs.tools.LC.name: showLiquidCleanerConfig
lpctools.configs.tools.LC.comment:
Enable to list the configs for LiquidCleaner
This tool helps you set blocks to clean liquid automatically
Needs a lot of water-undestroyable water-unloggable
non plant zero hardness blocks
lpctools.configs.tools.LC.limitInteractS:
Limit the interact speed of the liquid cleaner
Prevent being kicked out of some servers due to excessive packet sending

Set the maximum number of blocks
the liquid cleaner can fill or set (sum up) per tick on average
If ghost blocks or ghost items often appears,
you can try to decrease this value
lpctools.configs.tools.LC.disableOnGUIOp:
Disables Liquid Cleaner when GUI
(such as config screen, ESC screen or inventory screen)
opened
lpctools.configs.tools.LC.offhandFilling: Uses offhand to operate when enabled
lpctools.configs.tools.LC.blockBlackList:
Blocks excluded from being used by the fluid cleanup tool
For example, you can enter 'minecraft:slime_block'
This will restrict fluid cleanup to only use blocks like honey blocks or resin blocks
Prevents accidental damage to your TNT flying machines
lpctools.configs.tools.LC.ignoreDownward:
Since water cannot flow upwards,
downward fluid checks can be safely omitted for optimization
lpctools.configs.tools.LC.limitRange.exp:
Expands the cleaning area by one block
Aims to completely remove all fluids and cleanup blocks within the defined area
When disabled in water-submerged scenarios,
the outermost layer of cleanup blocks will remain as water barriers
lpctools.configs.tools.SX.name: Slight X-Ray Configs
lpctools.configs.tools.SX.comment:
Enable to show Slight X-Ray Configs
This tool highlights ores exposed in air
or near blocks that has just been broken
lpctools.configs.tools.SX.displayColor.c: Choose a color that will be used to highlight
lpctools.configs.tools.AG.name: Auto Grindstone Configs
lpctools.configs.tools.AG.comment:
Enable to list Auto Grindstone Configs
This tool helps you erase useless enchantments
lpctools.configs.tools.AG.limitEnchantme:
Only enchantments in this list(and below its max level if level is set)
will be erased by this tool
lpctools.configs.slightTools.title: Slight Tools
lpctools.configs.slightTools.blockReplac: Define an extra hotkey used to replace blocks, which reacts the same as pressing both mouse buttons.
lpctools.configs.debugs.title: Debugs
lpctools.configs.debugs.renderDebugShape: Enable to render some debug shapes
lpctools.configs.debugs.displayClickSlot:
Display the arguments when
net.minecraft.client.network.ClientPlayerInteractionManager.clickSlot()
is called
lpctools.configs.utils.limitRange.name: limitWorkingRange
lpctools.configs.utils.limitRange.commen:
Limits working range based on MiniHUD shapes and Litematica schematics or render range
so that you should install any of those mods to enable this config
lpctools.configs.utils.limitRange.rangeN:
Only regions with specific naming prefixes will be processed.
Assuming this config is "R" for example, then valid prefix formats include:
"+R","-R","+~R","-~R"
Symbol semantics explained in "Region Operation Mode" below.
lpctools.configs.utils.limitRange.rangeL:
Treat Litematica's render range as a special region for calculation.
Processing priority: After all Litematica schematics, but before other MiniHUD regions.
lpctools.configs.utils.limitRange.render:
Four operation modes for schematic render ranges:
"+": Add shape to allowed area (Union)
"-": Subtract shape from allowed area (Difference)
"+": Add area outside shape (Inverse Union)
"-": Keep only overlapping area (Intersection)
